items.title: US Fed Meeting: Jerome Powell-led FOMC announces third consecutive rate cut | 5 key highlights
items.summary: US Fed Meeting: US Federal Reserve FOMC on 10 December 2025, decided to lower the key interest rates for the US economy to the range of 3.50%-3.75% amid elevated inflation in America. Here are five key highlights from the US Fed's policy decision.

items.title: Oracle Posts Weak Cloud Sales, Raising Fear of Delayed Payoff
items.summary: Oracle Corp. posted disappointing cloud revenue, suggesting it will take longer than expected for the company’s recent huge AI bookings to pay off.

items.title: Trump says Fed rate cut should have been at least 50 bps—'rates should be lowest in the world'
items.summary: Speaking to reporters on Wednesday after Jerome Powell's speech following the Fed rate cut, Donald Trump said that the 25 bps cut was ‘rather small’ and asserted that it ‘could have been doubled, at least doubled’.

items.title: TSX posts record closing high after central bank rate decisions
items.summary: CANADA-STOCKS/ (UPDATE 2):CANADA STOCKS-TSX posts record closing high after central bank rate decisions

items.title: US Stock Market today: Dow jumps over 1.3%, S&P 500, Nasdaq rally after US Fed cuts interest rates — Details here
items.summary: US Stock Market today: Dow Jones, S&amp;P 500, and Nasdaq Composite rallied on Wednesday, 10 December 2025, after the Federal Reserve's FOMC decided to cut the benchmark interest rates of the US economy by 25 basis points for a third consecutive time.

items.title: Well positioned to wait and watch: US Fed's Jerome Powell on further rate cuts
items.summary: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell indicated the central bank is well-positioned to pause interest rate adjustments, awaiting further economic data. Having already cut rates by 75 basis points this year, the Fed funds rate is now considered within its neutral range. Powell clarified that a rate hike is not the base case for future policy decisions.

items.title: IndiGo Fiasco: Allegation that airline engineered crisis untrue, says chairman
items.summary: IndiGo Chairman Vikram Singh Mehta said on Wednesday that the airline did not attempt to bypass new pilot rest and duty norms.

items.title: Dow Jones rises 500 pts after US Fed cuts rates by 25 bps
items.summary: Indian markets reacted positively as the US Federal Reserve cut interest rates. The Dow Jones surged over 500 points. The Fed indicated a pause in further rate reductions, boosting investor confidence. Projections for economic growth were also raised. This move signals a stable economic outlook, encouraging investment in equities.

items.title: Fed delivers 25-bp rate cut in 2025's last review, FOMC logs first dissent in 6 years
items.summary: Fed Chair Jerome Powell has announced a rate cut, as widely expected by markets. The December 10 FOMC rate decision comes at a time when the absence of fuller macroeconomic data -- owing to the now-resolved record US government shutdown -- has fuelled uncertainty around the path of interest rates going forward.

items.title: One in five Vodafone Idea users inactive, finds study
items.summary: Vodafone Idea's reported subscriber numbers mask a significant portion of inactive users, impacting its average revenue per user and usage metrics. While the company has invested in network improvements and seen subscriber churn drop, a new study suggests its active paying base is smaller than reported, distorting key performance indicators compared to rivals.

items.title: Trai moots up to 55% cut in backhaul spectrum fees to reduce telcos' cost
items.summary: Telecom operators may soon see significant cost reductions. The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India has recommended slashing backhaul spectrum prices by up to 55%. This move aims to improve service quality and boost the use of backhaul carriers. The regulator is shifting to a uniform rate for spectrum pricing. This change will offer substantial financial relief to all telecom companies.

items.title: PHWR makers may build key parts for small modular reactors
items.summary: Indian industries are set to manufacture critical equipment for Small Modular Reactors. This initiative aligns with the 'Make in India' program. Companies with technical support from Bhabha Atomic Research Centre will produce components like special steel and pumps. Private sector participation will be through EPC contracts.

items.title: US Buys Own Boeing 737 Fleet to Speed Trump’s Deportation Push
items.summary: The US government will buy six Boeing Co. 737 jets to carry out deportation flights, expanding the administration’s efforts to ramp up the removals of people living in the country without legal status.

items.title: 'Systemic' issues behind Air India flights without Permit
items.summary: Air India's internal probe found systemic failures led to an aircraft flying eight scheduled flights without a valid license. The Continuing Airworthiness Management Organisation approved the flights despite a senior manager flagging the expiry. This incident raises serious questions about the airline's safety culture. Immediate measures are being implemented to prevent recurrence.

items.title: Apple to open fifth India store in Noida
items.summary: Apple is opening its fifth store in India, located in Noida's DLF Mall of India, marking its third store opening this year. This expansion underscores India's position as Apple's third-largest market. The new store, the third largest in India, will offer the full product line, customer support, and 'Today at Apple' sessions, anticipating significant customer turnout.

items.title: India slams China-led investment plan at WTO
items.summary: India has raised concerns at the World Trade Organization regarding a China-led proposal for an investment facilitation agreement. New Delhi argues that discussions on investment are outside the WTO's trade agreement framework. India emphasizes that such plurilateral agreements should remain exceptions, not the norm.

items.title: RBI may maintain repo rate at 5.25% through FY27: Fitch
items.summary: The commentary from BMI comes amid many economists and bond-market experts in India factoring in a further quarter percentage point reduction in policy rates, lowering terminal rate expectations to 5% in the current easing cycle after RBI looked past a sharply retreating rupee to deliver a rate cut last Friday.

items.title: Disruptions were not deliberate: IndiGo Chairman
items.summary: In a recent statement, Vikram Singh Mehta, chairman of IndiGo, addressed concerns about the ongoing flight disruptions. He clarified that the airline's board is actively collaborating with management to establish new pilot rest guidelines. Mehta reassured passengers that the recent cancellations were not intentional, attributing them instead to a combination of unforeseen internal and external factors.

items.title: Auditor flags lapses in Apple GCC's data backup, audit trails
items.summary: Apple's India operations facility has drawn auditor attention in its initial year. SR Batliboi & Associates highlighted issues with daily book backups and audit trails. The company has since implemented systems to meet legal requirements. These findings relate to Apple Operations India's support for the parent company's global activities. The facility procures equipment and employs engineers for R&D.

items.title: EU, US trade pacts progressing, says Piyush Goyal
items.summary: India's trade talks with the European Union and the United States are moving forward. Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal expressed confidence in early agreements. A US team is currently in New Delhi for discussions. Negotiations with Chile and Oman are also nearing completion. India is also pursuing trade pacts with Qatar and Israel.

items.title: Amid IPO boom, lawyers with capital markets exposure in demand
items.summary: Law firms are hiring more capital markets lawyers. This is driven by a rise in initial public offerings and other fundraising activities. Demand for equity offering specialists is growing as multinational companies plan to enter Indian markets. Successful listings have encouraged global groups to consider listing local operations. This trend is expected to continue.

items.title: US Federal Reserve cuts rates by 25 bps again, sets tone for 2026
items.summary: The US Federal Reserve cut its benchmark rate by 25 basis points, a move anticipated amid cooling inflation and mixed economic data. This decision, influenced by government shutdown delays and political pressure, sets a precedent for global monetary policy, impacting India's financial markets and currency.

items.title: Tipplers swap shots for pints as states shake up liquor laws
items.summary: Tipplers in Assam, Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra, West Bengal, and Meghalaya are choosing beer over hard spirits. This shift follows changes in taxation and retail expansion. Beer sales have surged significantly in these states. This trend indicates a move towards more moderate alcohol consumption and increased government revenue.

items.title: ReNew Power to raise $800m to refinance debt
items.summary: ReNew Power is raising $800 million through a five-year loan, with Societe Generale, Standard Chartered, and SMBC acting as lead banks. This significant borrowing, likely to be priced next quarter, will be used to refinance operational projects, aiming for a rate of 350-400 basis points over SOFR.

items.title: Four top refiners turn to Russia oil; Reliance Industries stays away
items.summary: Indian refiners are actively buying discounted Russian crude. Four of the seven largest processors are now sourcing non-sanctioned barrels. This comes as Reliance Industries avoids Russian oil to steer clear of sanctions. Imports are expected to continue at a reduced level into next year. Russian crude is currently priced attractively.

items.title: Parliament committee recommends reducing time for forest, environmental clearances for coal projects
items.summary: The committee also suggested streamlining process for public consultation and clearances from Gram Sabha to avoid delays.

items.title: Petronet LNG secures Rs 12,000 crore loan for petrochem project
items.summary: Petronet LNG has secured a significant ₹12,000 crore loan. State Bank of India and Bank of Baroda are providing the funds. This financing will primarily support Petronet's petrochemicals project. It will also cover other capital expenditure needs. The agreement follows a competitive bidding process. Petronet is India's largest LNG importer. It operates regasification terminals in Dahej and Kochi.

items.title: Propel to invest ₹300 crore in EV segment
Nestle India eyes massive rural growth, premiumisation in cities
items.summary: Nestle India is targeting significant growth in rural markets, which currently contribute only 15% of its revenue compared to other FMCG companies. The company plans to leverage its popular brands with affordable pack sizes to tap into the faster-growing rural economy. Simultaneously, Nestle will focus on premiumisation in urban areas for categories like chocolates and coffee.

items.title: New labelling rule coming soon: Clothes, home linen may have to tag care, origin, fabric details
items.summary: India is set to implement new mandatory labelling rules for apparel and home textiles, requiring manufacturers to disclose fibre content, origin, and care instructions. This move aims to align with global standards, promote recycling, and protect consumers from misleading claims. The initiative is part of a broader plan to boost the textile waste value chain and enhance consumer awareness.

items.title: Oil Ministry readies formula for new IOC board maths
items.summary: The Oil Ministry is planning a significant overhaul of Indian Oil Corporation's board. Three director positions are set to be eliminated as part of an organizational revamp. This move aims to consolidate responsibilities and reduce leadership layers within the company. The restructuring comes as public sector enterprises face pressure to improve efficiency. IOCL's top leadership reconfiguration could impact its performance.

items.title: IndiGo Chairman Vikram Singh Mehta hits back as crisis rocks India’s biggest airline
New Century Sofa India inks 2.72 lakh sq ft lease at IndoSpace Industrial Park
items.summary: IndoSpace has leased 2.72 lakh sq ft to New Century Sofa India at its Oragadam II Industrial Park. This deal underscores IndoSpace's accelerated investment in Tamil Nadu, a growing hub for manufacturing, and reflects strong demand from various sectors for Grade-A logistics facilities.

items.title: ADB lifts India's FY26 growth forecast to 7.2%
items.summary: The Asian Development Bank has raised India's growth forecast for the current financial year to 7.2%, citing stronger-than-expected second-quarter performance driven by robust domestic consumption. Despite an unfavorable base effect for 2026-27, policy measures are expected to offset potential drags, supporting continued economic expansion.

items.title: From passenger unit to capacity change — IndiGo cuts Q3 guidance amid flight cancellations
items.summary: From passenger unit to capacity change — India's largest airline operator, IndiGo, on 10 December 2025, decided to cut its October -December quarter (Q3) guidance for the financial year ending 2025-26 amid the major flight cancellations disruption over the crew rostering norms.&nbsp;

items.title: RBI talks to banks on uniform fee disclosure, removal of overlaps
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India is actively engaging with banks to bring consistency to service charge disclosures and eliminate duplicate fees. This initiative, which comes on the heels of state-run banks lifting penalties for not maintaining minimum average balances, seeks to simplify the charges presented to customers.

items.title: Unilever sees 'massive opportunities' in India, citing GST cut and high GDP growth
items.summary: Unilever CEO Fernando Fernandez sees "massive" opportunities in India, citing high GDP growth and recent GST reductions. He believes the company and its Indian arm, Hindustan Unilever, will be primary beneficiaries of a more dynamic economic environment. Fernandez highlighted significant growth potential across various income segments in India.

items.title: Tata Steel announces growth plan for India, confirms Thriveni stake buy
items.summary: Tata Steel unveiled its next growth phase in India, including a five-fold capacity expansion at Neelachal Ispat Nigam to 4.8 million tonne. The company will also establish rolling facilities at Meramandali, acquire a 50.01% stake in Thriveni Pellets, and partner with Lloyd Metals and Energy for mining and steelmaking ventures.

items.title: Big deal: TCS strikes its largest acquisition ever, buys Coastal Cloud for $700 million
items.summary: The buyout comes less than three months after India’s largest IT services firm stated it would invest $6.5 billion over six years to build 1GW of data centre capacity

items.title: Indian stocks are expected to stay expensive: HSBC report
items.summary: Research analysts across the market still maintain that earnings need to trim to reflect the tepid earnings of corporate India or the latter should grow up to justify the valuations

items.title: Stock to Track: This Navratna PSU bags over Rs 5,000 crore contract from Dilip Buildcon
items.summary: According to the company’s regulatory filing, the contract covers the development and operation of the mines along with the construction of an Overland Conveyor Corridor (OLCC) and associated facilities.

items.title: IndiGo submits revised winter flight schedule to DGCA after being told to cut flights
items.summary: IndiGo has submitted a revised winter flight schedule to the DGCA after being ordered to reduce operations by 10 per cent. The regulator raised concerns after the airline operated nearly 5,000 fewer flights than approved in November and recorded 951 cancellations. With the updated schedule now under review, passengers may see minor timing changes as IndiGo adjusts frequencies to ensure more stable operations.

items.title: IndiGo trims Q3 capacity guidance as cancellations eat into revenue, will issue Q4, FY26 projections: Key takeaways
items.summary: IndiGo said that measures undertaken to reset its operations resulted in the cancellation of around 4,500 flights in the first week of December.

items.title: Tata Steel board greenlights domestic expansion, moves to secure iron ore
items.summary: Tata Steel Ltd's board approved several expansion initiatives, including a 4.8 mtpa capacity increase at Neelachal Ispat Nigam and a new hot-rolling line in Tarapur. The company aims for 40 mtpa capacity by 2030 and has secured a 50.01% stake in Thriveni Pellets for iron ore production.

items.title: TCS acquires U.S. firm Coastal Cloud for $700 million
India should remain extremely cautious on giving concessions on agri products to US: GTRI
items.summary: India is urged to be cautious in trade talks with the US, particularly regarding agricultural and GMO products, and to demand significant tariff cuts on its exports. A think tank advises delaying commitments until the US Supreme Court rules on tariff authority.

items.title: Copper Resumes Gains as Traders Await Federal Reserve Meeting
items.summary: Copper and other industrial metals rose as investors awaited the US Federal Reserve’s final policy meeting of the year for clues on the central bank’s thinking about the US economy in 2026.

items.title: India–US Trade Talks: Both sides discuss mutually beneficial deal terms
items.summary: Both Indian and American delegations are learned to have exchanged views on a range of issues shaping trade ties between the world’s largest and fourth-largest economies, including ongoing efforts to ease market barriers and address long-standing concerns.

items.title: Pfizer layoffs: Pharma giant to cut hundreds of jobs in this country to reduce costs
items.summary: Pfizer layoffs: Pharma giant Pfizer is set to cut hundreds of jobs in Switzerland as part of the company's multi-year cost reduction program. Here's how many jobs the company plans to cut by the end of 2025.

items.title: Akasa Air expands its fleet to 31 aircrafts; new plane arrives at Bengaluru International Airport
items.summary: Akasa Air welcomed its 31st aircraft, a Boeing 737 MAX 8-200, featuring advanced Safran Z200 seats with enhanced comfort and connectivity. This delivery marks a significant step in the airline's expansion, reflecting its commitment to passenger experience and sustainability. Akasa Air plans to induct 195 more aircraft in the coming years.

items.title: SBI, BoB get RBI nod to set up fraud detection platform
items.summary: Indian Digital Payment Intelligence Corporation will be established as a Section 8 company (a special type of non-profit organisation) under the Companies Act, 2013

items.title: Indian drugmaker Zee Laboratories promises cheap alternatives - but there's a catch
items.summary: Zee Laboratories' drugs face persistent quality issues, with over 86 failed regulatory tests in India and abroad. Despite multiple prosecutions for substandard medicines, the company has seen no convictions. Regulators continue issuing public warnings about the potential dangers of these widely distributed drugs.

items.title: Cotton panel pegs production, imports and exports of the natural fibre lower this season
items.summary: Imports could drop to 40 lakh bales, while exports may slip to 15 lakh bales: CCPC provisional estimate

items.title: Bank of Baroda recognised as ‘Best Bank in India’ by The Banker
items.summary: The Banker says BoB has improved customer experience by enhancing its phygital banking services

items.title: Attention NRIs! Sebi eases re-KYC norms, no physical presence required in India. Details here
items.summary: Sebi has simplified the re-KYC process for NRIs by removing the need for their physical presence in India during digital verification.&nbsp;

items.title: IndiGo sends DGCA revised schedule with reduced winter flights
items.summary: IndiGo has submitted a revised winter flight schedule to the DGCA after the aviation regulator mandated a 10% reduction due to crew shortages. This cut, amounting to approximately 220 flights daily, aims to align the airline's operations with available pilots. The revised schedule was submitted by Wednesday's deadline.

items.title: DGCA officials to conduct on-site inspections of IndiGo operations across 11 airports
items.summary: DGCA officials are conducting on-site inspections at 11 domestic airports to assess IndiGo's operations amid widespread disruptions. These inspections aim to evaluate safety, operational preparedness, and passenger facilitation measures. The move follows significant passenger inconvenience caused by thousands of flight cancellations due to crew shortages.

items.title: Tata Steel board takes multiple decisions to secure future
Govt revises draft TRP rules to ensure fair competition and accurate TV ratings
items.summary: The Government has released a revised draft of India’s TRP guidelines to strengthen fair competition, improve accuracy and reflect evolving media consumption. The update follows wide-ranging feedback on an earlier draft and aims to modernise the decade-old framework governing rating agencies. The Ministry said the new system will support transparency, prevent manipulation and better represent the diversity of Indian viewership.

items.title: Stocks mixed, tech weakens before expected Fed rate cut
items.summary: GLOBAL-STOCKS:Stocks mixed, tech weakens before expected Fed rate cut

items.title: Uber rolls out ONDC-led B2B logistics play, targets India’s last-mile market
items.summary: Uber India head Prabhjeet Singh stated that the service will initially rely on its growing two-wheeler fleet, effectively turning every Uber bike into a multi-use asset for passenger rides, consumer couriers, and B2B ONDC logistics.

items.title: IndiGo to rope in external expert as board probes nationwide meltdown; Chairman issues unconditional apology
items.summary: IndiGo is bringing in an external technical expert to investigate recent operational issues.  The airline experienced widespread cancellations and delays earlier this month.  Chairman Vikram Singh Mehta has apologized to affected customers.  The investigation will cover all aspects of the disruptions.  Corrective actions will be taken to prevent future occurrences.  IndiGo assures that safety and compliance with rules were maintained.

items.title: India needs national soil health framework: NIPHM DG
items.summary: Pesticide overuse is rendering several crops unacceptable for exporting, says NIPHM DG Sagar Hanuman Singh

items.title: Petronet LNG inks secured term loan facility of ₹12,000 crore
items.summary: The RTL facility is intended to be utilised primarily for financing the petrochemicals project and other capital expenditure needs of the company

items.title: US dollar retreats amid overall caution ahead of Fed decision
items.summary: GLOBAL-FOREX:US dollar retreats amid overall caution ahead of Fed decision

items.title: SAT upholds SEBI ruling on Linde India’s related-party transactions
items.summary: The order was passed on December 5 by a bench comprising Presiding Officer Justice PS Dinesh Kumar and technical members Meera Swarup and Dheeraj Bhatnagar

items.title: IndusInd Bank chairman to step down in January
India offers strong potential for growth, source of innovation and talent for global markets for Amazon
items.summary: The company on Wednesday announced plans to make fresh investments of $35 billion by 2030 in India

items.title: Fed poised to cut rates but Powell may flag a pause ahead; here's why
items.summary: Inflation worries, rising unemployment and internal splits set the stage for a tense December policy call at the US central bank.

items.title: RBI sets Rs 12,801 as redemption price for SGBs
items.summary: The Reserve Bank on Wednesday announced a redemption price of Rs 12,801 per unit for two series of sovereign gold bonds.

items.title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Thursday
items.summary: Indian markets closed lower as Sensex and Nifty erased early gains amid profit-booking ahead of the U.S. Fed decision. Global volatility, BOJ tightening signals, FII outflows, rupee weakness and trade-deal uncertainty weighed on sentiment. Technical indicators point to sustained near-term pressure with key support levels being tested.

items.title: 'Airline turmoil hits national economy': Delhi HC pulls up Centre over IndiGo crisis
items.summary: The Delhi High Court on Wednesday pulled up the Union government over the widespread cancellations and delays of Indigo flights, asking why the situation was allowed to precipitate into a nationwide turmoil that stranded lakhs of passengers and inflicted losses on the national economy.

items.title: UK firms boost India presence, turnover hits Rs 5,693 bn as FTA growth unlocked: Report
items.summary: UK companies are significantly expanding their presence in India, with a collective turnover of Rs 5,693 billion and 552,902 employees. The Free Trade Agreement is expected to unlock further growth across advanced manufacturing, clean energy, and digital trade, fostering innovation and job creation for both economies.

items.title: What's Google's AI Plus plan all about? From Gemini 3 Pro access to smarter tools, 6 key things to know
items.summary: Google has launched the AI Plus plan in India, giving users broader access to Gemini 3 Pro, enhanced image and video generation tools, NotebookLM for deep research, and seamless integration across Gmail, Docs and other apps. The plan also includes 200 GB cloud storage and family sharing, priced at Rs 399 per month, with a Rs 199 introductory offer. Backed by Google's new safety roadmap for India - including on-device scam alerts - the subscription aims to make advanced AI tools more accessible and secure.

items.title: What provoked Trump's Indian rice outburst?
items.summary: President Trump's accusations of India "dumping" rice in the U.S. market appear politically motivated, aimed at appeasing American farmers hurt by his tariff wars.  Despite the trade's small scale, the move signals pressure to address rural discontent ahead of crucial elections.

items.title: Unacademy explores M&A, says CEO Gaurav Munjal
items.summary: Once valued at $3.5 billion at the height of the pandemic boom, the company is now worth “less than $500 million,” he said, adding that consolidation could be a logical next step

items.title: Tata Steel plans major expansion, backward integration
items.summary: To acquire 50.01 per cent stake in Thriveni Pellets for ₹636 cr

items.title: US Stock Market Today: Wall Street mixed ahead of Fed decision, GE Vernova climbs 15%
items.summary: As of 12:33 P.M. Eastern Time, the S&amp;P 500 was mostly flat, the Dow Jones Industrial Average was up 0.4%, and the Nasdaq Composite was 0.3% lower

items.title: India-Italy ties driven by shared culture and commitment to global stability: EAM Jaishankar
items.summary: Welcoming Italy’s Deputy Prime Minister and Foreign Minister Antonio Tajani to New Delhi, Jaishankar noted that Tajani’s second visit to India this year reflects the strong momentum in bilateral ties.

items.title: Coimbatore’s Propel Industries looking at 15-18% revenue growth this fiscal
items.summary: Propel serves over 50 countries with over 3,000 installations and a growing range of over 135 equipment models that support end-to-end material processing and hauling requirements, he said.

items.title: Nifty extends losing streak to third day ahead of Fed policy decision
items.summary: Investors adopt cautious stance amid persistent foreign institutional investor outflows and rupee weakness

items.title: 'Looking forward to serving India': Elon Musk on Starlink VP meeting Telecom Minister
items.summary: Elon Musk announced his readiness to serve India via Starlink, following a meeting between SpaceX's senior leadership and Telecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia. The discussions focused on enhancing satellite-based last-mile internet access, aiming to extend connectivity to remote and rural areas for accelerated digital inclusion and development.

items.title: India plans ‘many interventions’ by March ‘26 amid farmers’ complaints on urea shortage
items.summary: The interventions will not only help the industry to gain more credibility, but also help farmers, says Fertiliser Secretary Rajat Mishra

items.title: Gold rates today: MCX gold price remains steady ahead of US Federal Reserve policy decision
items.summary: Gold prices in India remained steady on December 10 as traders awaited a Federal Reserve interest-rate cut. MCX gold opened higher but later traded 0.24% lower. The Fed is expected to cut rates, but policymakers remain divided on inflation and labor market concerns.

items.title: Adani Group to invest $75 b in energy transition over 5 years
items.summary: Adani Group Chairman said that Jharkhand, particularly Dhanbad, holds significant potential

items.title: Road work slows despite city-wide digging; industry flags dip
items.summary: Payment delays, land acquisition bottlenecks and election-year distractions among factors for the slowdown

items.title: Google launches ‘AI Plus’ plan in India with Gemini 3 Pro access at Rs 399/month, intro offer under Rs 200
items.summary: Google launched Google AI Plus in India, a subscription plan that expands access to its latest AI models, multimedia tools and other features.

items.title: Bank of Baroda to cut MCLR by 0.05% from December 12; overnight, 3-month tenures to get cheaper — borrowers to see marginal relief
items.summary: Bank of Baroda will reduce its overnight and three-month MCLR by 0.05 per cent from Friday, offering slight EMI relief for borrowers. The revision reflects easing funding costs and could mark the beginning of more competitive lending rates across the banking sector if inflation stays on track.

items.title: India’s offers are the best, but there is resistance on row crops: USTR
items.summary: New Delhi says it will not bend on its sensitivities on GM crops, meat, dairy; the trade pact has to be worked around it

items.title: US stocks subdued ahead of Fed interest rate verdict
items.summary: Wall Street's main stock indexes opened little changed on Wednesday, ahead of a Federal Reserve monetary policy decision that is widely expected to deliver an interest rate cut, while investors remain wary of hawkish commentary on the path of future easing.

items.title: PM Modi to inaugurate new terminal building of the Lokapriya Gopinath Bordoloi International Airport
items.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate Guwahati's new Lokapriya Gopinath Bordoloi International Airport terminal on December 20. This new structure, inspired by Northeast India's vernacular architecture and natural beauty, features a unique bamboo Vault and a 'Vault Village' for community engagement. The terminal aims to boost regional connectivity and trade.

items.title: BoI raises ₹2,500 crore via Tier II bonds at 7.28%
items.summary: The base issue size was ₹1,000 crore with a green shoe option of ₹1,500 crore

items.title: Maharatna PSU Stock in Focus: Russia likely to approve Su-57E Izdeliye-177S tech transfer, say sources
items.summary: Maharatna PSU HAL is set to be in focus in the next session on Dalal Street. According to sources, Russia may agree to fully transfer the Su-57E Izdeliye-177S engine technology to India.

items.title: Honeywell licenses bioethanol-based aviation fuel technology to Indian firm
items.summary: The licensee is currently securing approvals, land, feedstock and offtake arrangements

items.title: US receives best ever offers from India, says USTR; two-day talks begin
items.summary: India and the US are holding trade talks in New Delhi. US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer noted India's best-ever offers for a trade agreement. Both nations aim to finalize a mutually beneficial pact. This is crucial as the US has imposed steep tariffs on Indian goods. Negotiations are progressing towards a bilateral trade agreement.

items.title: Share India Securities' share price to be in focus on Thursday. Here's why
items.summary: Share India Securities plans to issue up to 5,000 non-convertible debentures totaling  ₹50 crore, with a green shoe option of 2,500 NCDs. Despite recent stock declines, the company’s long-term performance shows a 530% increase over five years.

items.title: Sumadhura group to build ₹600 crore Industrial Park
items.summary: The facility will offer plug-and-play facilities for the aerospace, automotive, pharmaceutical, and e-commerce sectors

items.title: Draft ToR for Qatar trade pact, in process to secure internal nod for Oman FTA: Govt
items.summary: India is actively pursuing trade pacts, sharing draft terms for a Free Trade Agreement with Qatar and finalizing internal approvals for a similar deal with Oman. Negotiations are also progressing with Israel and the Maldives, with Terms of Reference signed for both. Discussions are also underway with the Gulf Cooperation Council.

items.title: Swiggy’s $1.1 billion share sale sees demand from Temasek, top funds
items.summary: India’s top asset managers including SBI Funds Management, ICICI Prudential Asset Management and HDFC Asset Management also participates in offering

items.title: Decision Day Guide: US Fed rate cut this time may be the last for a while
items.summary: The Federal Reserve is set to deliver a third consecutive rate cut, but internal divisions over inflation and economic risks may halt further easing. With limited fresh data and conflicting policy views, Chair Jerome Powell faces a difficult task in guiding forward expectations.

items.title: Virat has a ‘very sharp business mind’, reveals Agilitas Sports co-founder as King Kohli discloses investment strategy
items.summary: Abhishek Ganguly reminisced about his first meeting with Virat Kohli, who later became an investor in Agilitas Sports. Kohli's commitment and business mindset influenced Ganguly, leading to a partnership in the brand one8 and a strategic investment in Agilitas.

items.title: Russia prioritises lasting peace in Ukraine over ceasefire: Kremlin
items.summary: Zelensky stated that Ukraine was working on a proposal to have an energy truce with Russia, indicating that he expected Russia to implement the mechanism.

items.title: Meesho to inject Rs 2,890 crore into Meesho Tech after strong IPO launch
items.summary: Funds from the Rs 5,421 crore IPO will power cloud expansion, brand building and AI-driven tech investments at the subsidiary.

items.title: Sebi to work with other regulators on all-in-one financial asset statement, says Pandey
items.summary: Currently, investors in the securities market can access a consolidated statement of holdings across products, including equities, debt instruments and mutual funds, through the depositories.

items.title: Delaware Court reverses prior judgment of $1 b damages against Byju Raveendran
items.summary: The court’s decision — triggered by a motion to correct the judgment filed by Raveendran — acknowledges that damages were never formally determined

items.title: SEBI relaxes re-KYC process for NRIs; removes physical presence clause
items.summary: While onboarding still requires an India-based location, re-KYC for existing NRI clients can now be done from abroad

items.title: Cipla launches drug for obesity, diabetes
items.summary: Cipla has launched Yurpeak, a new injectable medication for obesity and type-2 diabetes. This one-weekly therapy, tirzepatide, is now available in India. Yurpeak aims to address two significant health challenges in the country. Cipla is collaborating with Eli Lilly for this innovative treatment. The drug will be offered in multiple strengths.

items.title: IndusInd Bank chief Mehta could exit bank next month, say sources

items.title: Adani Enterprises’  ₹25,000-crore rights issue receives strong response, oversubscribed by 108%
items.summary: Adani Enterprises'  ₹25,000-crore rights issue, one of India's largest, received a strong response with a 108% subscription rate. items.title: IFFCO scouting for JV partners to set up fertiliser plants abroad, secure supply for India
items.summary: Plans JVs in Sri Lanka, Senegal to ensure steady inputs

items.title: Uber doubles down on India bets with ONDC-powered B2B logistics, metro ticketing push

items.title: Adani Green Energy: Quant MF, other funds buy stake in Rs 2,778 crore block deal
items.summary: Adani Green Energy saw a Rs 2,778 crore block deal as Total Energies sold 2.86 crore shares, absorbed by major institutional buyers and family offices. Despite near-term weakness and volatile price trends, long-term growth prospects and strategic partnerships remain intact.

items.title: ET Market Watch: Sensex, Nifty extend 3-day losing streak ahead of Fed rate decision
High activity start-up hubs see larger share of closures
items.summary: According to data from the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT), a total of 6,385 recognised start-ups have been categorised as closed (dissolved/struck-oﬀ) as on October 31 2025.

items.title: Nothing Phone (3a) Community Edition smartphone launched in India: Check price, features, availability and other details
items.summary: Nothing has launched the Phone (3a) Community Edition in India, marking the latest outcome of the company’s unique Community Edition Project. The initiative flips the traditional product-feedback model by inviting creators, designers and fans to help shape real consumer tech—from hardware and software to packaging and promotion.

items.title: Sebi relaxes re-KYC process for NRIs; removes physical presence clause
items.summary: Markets regulator Sebi on Wednesday eased the re-KYC process for Non-Resident Indians (NRIs) by removing the requirement for them to be physically present in India during digital verification.

items.summary: The relaxation is aimed at making the re-KYC process smoother and more accessible for NRIs

items.title: Indian Railways bans reels and videos on duty; strict action if employees are caught
items.summary: The directive notes that several employees had been shooting videos related to train operations, safety procedures, and sensitive locations, and uploading them online.

items.title: Tesla stock is this bank’s top pick. Why it can accelerate into 2026 and beyond.
items.summary: AI can drive Tesla shares higher in 2026, says Deutsche Bank, if the macro economy cooperates.

items.title: Bank of India raises Rs 2,500 cr from Tier II bonds
items.summary: State-owned Bank of India (BoI) on Wednesday said it has raised Basel III-compliant Tier II bonds of Rs 2,500 crore to fund business growth.

items.title: One bitcoin bull cuts forecast by half as "cold breeze" blows
items.summary: Standard Chartered has halved its bitcoin price forecasts for 2025 and 2026, citing weaker demand and a shift toward ETF-driven buying. Analyst Geoff Kendrick now sees slower long-term growth, delaying his $500,000 target to 2030 amid deteriorating crypto sentiment.

items.title: In 2026, organisations will invest in data, AI readiness, ‘Human-AI chemistry’: Capgemini
items.summary: According to the firm, tech sovereignty has moved from a policy concept to a strategic priority amid geopolitical uncertainty

items.title: Indian Railways to run its first hydrogen train to demonstrate 'Atmanirbhar Bharat'
items.summary: Indian Railways is launching its first hydrogen train, which showcases new hydrogen-powered train technology. The train, designed and built in India, is the world's longest and most powerful on a broad-gauge platform. It produces zero CO2 emissions, releasing only water vapor.

items.title: Indian silver prices gain ₹7,457 a kg on strong demand, short-supply
items.summary: Tighter global inventories, decade-low Chinese stockpiles, and elevated borrowing costs in London have intensified the supply squeeze, amplifying price momentum.

items.title: Oil PSU Stocks to Buy: Cheap crude signals up to 54% upside — HPCL leads the list
items.summary: Oil PSU Stocks: Antique Stock Broking has released a strong report on oil marketing companies — HPCL, BPCL and Indian Oil. The brokerage said these stocks are currently in a sweet spot from an investment perspective, with both the outlook and valuations looking attractive. As a result, it has maintained a buy recommendation on all three.

items.title: RBI wants MFIs to expand product base
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India is urging microfinance companies to diversify their lending beyond traditional group-based loans. Officials recommend exploring asset classes like inventory and capital asset financing to enhance stability and economic contribution. This push aims to move NBFC-MFIs from single-product offerings to comprehensive micro-enterprise finance solutions.

items.title: Amul extends partnership with Argentina Football Association for 4th year
items.summary: Founded in 1893, the Argentina Football Association (AFA) is South America’s oldest football governing body and one of the most decorated in global football

items.title: Telecom body backs SIM-binding order, dismisses privacy concerns
items.summary: Telecom operators back the DoT's SIM-binding rule for messaging apps, calling privacy concerns 'misplaced narratives.' This move aims to ensure user identification and combat fraud.  The Cellular Operators Association of India argues it's a vital security measure, comparable to UPI authentication, and will significantly enhance national security.

items.title: NCLT dismisses RCom plea seeking  ₹325-crore refund from Ericsson
items.summary: RCom was seeking a partial repayment of the  ₹550 crore that Reliance Group paid Ericsson in 2019 to purge a Supreme Court contempt order for repeatedly defaulting on its dues to the Swedish company.

items.title: TRAI launches pilot to give customers control over promotional messages
items.summary: Telecom Regulatory Authority of India is launching a pilot for digital consent management. Select customers will receive SMS notifications to review and manage their consent for promotional messages. This initiative involves major banks and telecom providers. The system aims to provide users with control over their communication preferences. It will test a unified digital platform before a wider rollout.

items.title: India-US trade talks: Piyush Goyal sees progress as commerce secretary meets US Dy Trade Rep Rick Switzer
items.summary: Piyush Goyal remains optimistic about US trade negotiations, mentioning productive talks and future meetings. Despite challenges from US tariffs, discussions on a Bilateral Trade Agreement continue, with multiple rounds held to enhance India-US economic relations.

items.title: Energy transition-focused fund Transition VC closes its debut fund at ₹700 cr
items.summary: More than half of the fund has already been committed, and the firm is actively looking to deploy the remaining capital into founders building high-conviction solutions across the energy transition spectrum

items.title: Nephrocare Health IPO off to slow start, subscribed 0.13x on opening day
items.summary: Nephrocare Health Services' IPO launched on December 10 garnered a lackluster response, recording only 0.13 times subscription. The company plans to raise  ₹871.05 crore to enhance dialysis services and reduce debt, with a listing expected on December 17.

items.title: Restaurant chain Social partners Cityflo to run experiential bar hop
items.summary: Restaurant chain Social and bus-mobility firm Cityflo have launched Mumbai's first experiential Bar Hop, transforming buses into social spaces. This initiative aims to showcase how public transit can host community gatherings and entertainment, with participants enjoying a four-hour journey across three Social outlets featuring onboard music and games.

items.title: Nestle India's finance chief Svetlana Boldina to step down
items.summary: Nestle India's Chief Financial Officer, Svetlana Boldina, will depart on January 31, 2026, to assume a new role within a Nestle affiliate. This leadership transition occurs amidst a period of reshuffling at other major Indian consumer companies due to recent muted earnings. A successor for the CFO position will be announced soon.

items.title: US Fed expected to cut rates, but may signal a coming pause
items.summary: The U.S. Federal Reserve is expected to cut interest rates on Wednesday as policymakers grapple with gaps in economic data caused by the recent government shutdown and work through competing views about the risks facing the economy.

items.summary: India and Sweden are joining forces for a cleaner industrial future. Seven projects will explore new ways to cut emissions in steel and cement production. These initiatives aim to use hydrogen in steelmaking and recycle materials for green cement. Artificial intelligence will also support efforts to reduce carbon in cement.

items.title: Delhi trade, tourism sectors face Rs 1000 crore loss due to IndiGo crisis: Trade body
items.summary: Delhi's trade, industry, and tourism sectors have reportedly incurred losses of Rs 1000 crore due to widespread IndiGo flight cancellations. The disruptions have led to a 25% drop in market footfall and a significant decrease in business arrivals, impacting hotel and restaurant bookings during the peak season.

items.title: Silver may soar further in the global market on ‘physical shortage’
items.summary: The shortage could be gauged from how the silver-crude oil ratio zoomed to its second-highest level ever, say experts

items.title: DPR underway for doubling 263 km of Konkan Railway: Minister
items.summary: Konkan Railway has a total route km of 739 km from Roha in Maharashtra to Thokur in Mangaluru of Karnataka, which passes through difficult terrain of Western Ghats

items.title: PM Modi, Piyush Goyal expected to travel to Oman next week to sign free trade agreement
items.summary: Separately, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal confirmed that FTA talks with New Zealand and the European Union are in their final stages

items.title: US bankruptcy court reverses $1 bn damages against Byju Raveendran
items.summary: A US bankruptcy court on 8 December 2025 reversed $1 billion in damages against Byju Raveendran. Earlier this year, Byju's creditors, including GLAS Trust, sued and accused Raveendran, along with others, of masterminding the theft of $533 million in loan proceeds.

items.title: Adani Enterprises' Rs 25,000 cr rights issue gets 108% subscription; GQG, top funds participate
items.summary: Adani Enterprises’ Rs 25,000 crore rights issue closed with strong demand, ending at 108% subscription. The public portion was even stronger at 130% subscribed. Priced at Rs 1,800 per share, the issue will help the company reduce debt and fund capex across airports, data centres, green hydrogen and other growth businesses.

items.title: Marking 30 years, Makino India’s next move in precision manufacturing for EVs, aerospace and semiconductors
items.summary: With over 8,000 machines installed and localisation touching 50 per cent, the company prepares for its next growth wave powered by automation, high-tech sectors and digital machining, deploying data and smart technology, including artificial intelligence

items.title: Corona Remedies IPO: Issue subscribed 144 times on Day 03; NII, QIB portions see huge demand, GMP signals 25% premium
items.summary: Corona Remedies' IPO saw a remarkable 144.4 times subscription rate, driven by high institutional demand. The issue, priced between  ₹1008-1062, is expected to list on December 15, with a grey market premium indicating a listing price of  ₹1,332 per share.&nbsp;

items.title: French drugmaker Servier firms up India focus with manufacturing tie-ups, trial plans
items.summary: The company recently received market authorization from the Indian drug regulator for its drug Vorasidenib, a first-in-class, oral therapy for adults or children over 12 with grade-2 gliomas or types of brain cancer, with specific genetic mutations.&nbsp;

items.title: Wakefit Innovations IPO: GMP drops sharply! Issue receives 2.52 times bids on final day
items.summary: Wakefit's IPO, launched on December 10, was oversubscribed 2.52 times, driven by strong retail interest. The company reported  ₹724 crore in revenue and  ₹35.5 crore profit for the six months ending September 2025, with promoter shareholding set to drop to 37%.

items.title: US Fed Meeting 2025 LIVE: Jerome Powell-led FOMC cuts key interest rates to 3.50%-3.75% amid elevated US inflation
items.summary: US Fed Meeting 2025 LIVE: The US Federal Reserve FOMC cuts key interest rates by 25 bps to 3.50%-3.75% amid elevated US inflation on Wednesday, 10 December 2025. All eyes are now on Chairman Jerome Powell's address for the outlook of the central bank and any comments on the rate cut trajectory.

items.title: Inox Wind, Dixon Tech, 7 other stocks hit 52-week lows & slip up to 20% in a month
items.summary: Seven BSE 500 stocks, including Inox Wind, Dixon Technologies, Piramal Pharma and Blue Dart, hit fresh 52-week lows as the Sensex fell 275 points. All saw sharp one-month declines ranging from 8% to 20% amid broader market weakness.

items.title: Music tourism booms as over 5.6 lakh Indians travel for concerts in 2025: Report
items.summary: Indians are travelling for entertainment, boosting music tourism and live events.  Premium experiences are growing, with state governments supporting the sector.  Cinema remains popular, with regional films and re-releases drawing crowds.

items.summary: Volkswagen India is offering early retirement to its 2,300 factory workers as part of a broader restructuring to boost growth in the country. Both plants in Maharashtra are operating below capacity, and the voluntary scheme, supported by worker unions, provides financial incentives based on years of service.

items.summary: Howard Marks says AI may be a transformational “inflection bubble,” urging investors to avoid going all-in or all-out. He highlights soaring valuations, circular financing, rising leverage, speculative behaviour and past bubble patterns, advising moderation, prudence and selective exposure amid massive uncertainty.

items.title: Amul extends partnership with Argentina Football Association as regional sponsor
items.summary: Amul has extended its partnership with the Argentina Football Association (AFA) as the Official Regional Sponsor for another season, marking their fourth year of association. This renewed alliance will cover the period leading up to the World Cup 2026. Amul, the first Indian regional sponsor for AFA, expressed pride in continuing to support the FIFA World Cup Champions.

items.title: Trump’s rice tariff threat unlikely to significantly hurt India’s exports
items.summary: US President Trump's threat of new rice tariffs is unlikely to significantly impact India, as the US market is small and already has high duties. This move appears to be a negotiating tactic amid ongoing trade talks, with India seeking removal of existing tariffs on its exports.

India is seeking relief from steep U.S. tariffs imposed over its Russian oil purchases, which have hit key exports.

Crew shortages and new duty rules are cited as reasons. IndiGo is working to stabilize operations and recruit more crew. The regulator has also reduced IndiGo's flight schedule.

items.summary: Elbers has been instructed to submit a complete report and appear before the DGCA on December 11, 2025

items.summary: Flywings Simulator Training Centre IPO allotment date is fixed as Wednesday, December 10. The offer allotment is generally finalised a day after the closure of the issue. The  ₹57.05 crore IPO was open for bidding from December 5 to December 9, garnering 1.67 times bids.

items.summary: Global investors including Temasek and Capital Group, along with major Indian asset managers such as SBI MF, ICICI Prudential, and HDFC AMC, have placed bids to buy shares in Swiggy as the company seeks fresh funding a year after its listing. items.summary: Geojit Equity Research

items.summary: Ageas Federal, a joint venture between the Ageas Group and Federal Bank that began operations in 2008, operates through 3,770-plus branches including partner bank branches

items.summary: The Indian rupee slipped on Wednesday, ending a session of back-and-forth price action shaped by portfolio flows, likely maturity of positions in the non-deliverable forwards market and caution ahead of the Federal Reserve's policy decision.

items.summary: PLI schemes have seen exports crossing Rs 7.5 lakh crore with significant contributions from electronics, pharmaceuticals, telecom and networking products, and food processing sectors

items.title: Commercial tower in Dubai named after Shah Rukh Khan sold out for over Rs 5k cr
items.summary: The echoes of success resonate throughout Dubai, as Danube Group announces the total sell-out of their landmark project, 'SHAHRUKHZ by Danube'. This striking commercial tower, lining the iconic Sheikh Zayed Road, has generated a remarkable revenue of over Rs 5,000 crore, underscoring the vibrant demand for commercial real estate in the emirate.

items.title: Here’s how India’s food supply chain could respond to climate change in a way everyone will gain from
items.summary: India’s food system faces a climate reckoning. Private sector efforts, aided by public support, could find a pragmatic path ahead that works in favour of everyone involved, from farmers and businesses to all other inhabitants of the planet.

items.summary: Vietnam's State Treasury raised 7.95 trillion dong ($302 million) in a weekly government bond auction on Wednesday, up from $298 million raised last week, with the coupon for 10-year bonds hitting the highest this year.

items.summary: The Virtual Reality & AI rehabilitation system can help cancer patients experiencing chronic pain, neuropathy, fatigue or limited mobility

items.summary: At a time when its parent, Nestle SA, has announced global job cuts for cost savings, Tiwary said Nestle looks at India as market with immense growth opportunities, where it has invested ₹3,900 crore in the past two fiscal years

items.summary: Germany's 10-year borrowing costs hit fresh multi-month highs on Wednesday as traders price out any chance of further European Central Bank rate cuts, while looking ahead to an important Federal Reserve meeting later in the day.

items.summary: The airline said it is looking to ramp up its flight operations amid the growing demand across key routes this winter, and also to ensure adequate capacity in the market

items.summary: Indian equities ended lower on Wednesday as investors booked profits and stayed cautious ahead of the U.S. Fed policy outcome. Financials, IT, and broader markets weakened, while IndiGo slid after mandated flight cuts. Meesho’s strong listing offered a bright spot, but global volatility and foreign outflows kept sentiment subdued.

items.title: IPO verdict: Meesho has levers, Aequs has margins, Vidya Wires needs time, says Sunny Agrawal

He sees Aequs as a niche, high-margin long-term aerospace play, while urging investors to book profits in Vidya Wires and wait for earnings clarity before taking long-term exposure.

An internal probe revealed systemic failures in document checks and communication. This incident put hundreds of lives at risk. The airline has suspended some staff and is strengthening compliance protocols.

items.summary: The Competition Commission of India may investigate IndiGo for potential antitrust violations related to market dominance and passenger treatment. The DGCA continues to lead inquiries amid a crisis where IndiGo cancelled over 5,000 flights this month.

items.summary: Manish Tiwary, Nestlé India's new chairman, aims to transform the company by leveraging technology for efficiency and innovation, enhancing brand investment, and expanding reach in urban and rural markets. He wants shorter production runs and quicker launches while focusing on premium products.

items.summary: Major indices on Dalal Street continued to decline, marking three consecutive days of losses as investors reacted cautiously ahead of the US Federal Reserve's decision. items.summary: Park Medi World’s IPO, valuing the hospital chain at Rs 920 crore, saw a 39% subscription on Day 1. Analysts broadly have assigned a “Subscribe" for the IPO with a long-term vision citing strong healthcare growth prospects.

items.title: Can US Fed rate cut give a shot in the arm to Indian stock market bulls? Not really, suggest past 5 instances

items.summary: Execution bottlenecks such as connectivity delays, land hurdles, and right-of-way constraints remain the energy sector’s hardest problems to solve.

Power Finance Corporation leads, followed by REC, LIC Housing Finance, Bank of Maharashtra and Bharat Petroleum. items.summary: The court rejected Intel’s main challenge against the European Commission's finding that the company illegally abused its dominant market position to harm competitors, notably Advanced Micro Devices

items.title: India Budget Basics: If the calculations puzzle you, this is how the budget maths really works

items.summary: IndiGo meltdown: There is no winner in the entire situation; there are only losers and that starts with the lakhs of passengers who are stranded across the country with no hope of reaching home or their intended destination at their planned times.

items.title: VCs favour technologists, not hustlers, in India’s new AI, deep-tech wave
items.summary: Startups spun out of IITs, research labs, and patent-heavy teams are attracting more funding as investors prioritise technical depth over execution-first founders.

items.title: Too much power, too little grid: Why Adani, NTPC and JSW are forced to cut solar power production
items.summary: What happens when solar power capacity races ahead while transmission capacity lags? A bottleneck, that has forced the grid regulator to step in and direct power production cuts at Adani Group, NTPC Green, KKR-backed Serentica, EQT-backed Zelestra and JSW Group

items.title: The celebrity YouTube surge: Low costs, high reach, total control
items.summary: Film and sports stars are increasingly creating standalone content on YouTube and social media, allowing them direct access to their audience and creative control. This shift from traditional media enables them to build personal brands and generate revenue while maintaining visibility.

items.title: RBI not in favour of runaway credit growth, says real interest rates still “quite high”
items.summary: The RBI is comfortable with current credit growth at 1x GDP. Governor Malhotra indicated that high growth rates can negatively affect asset quality. He remains optimistic about the economy's stability, particularly in secured loan segments, despite minor concerns in unsecured loans.

items.title: Private credit booms in India as firms seek faster, flexible capital
items.summary: Domestic and global funds are racing to provide non-dilutive, flexible capital as companies seek faster financing and banks step back, while investors hunt steadier returns than equity can offer.

items.title: Observer effect: Inside India’s media measurement meltdown
items.summary: 25 years ago, the business of advertising moved online with the promise of better measurement and more accountability. Traditional mediums followed suit so that today, advertisers and publishers are drowning in data. So why is media measurement still so untrustworthy?&nbsp;

items.title: New-age companies spot gold at the bottom of the pyramid
items.summary: E-bikes to eyewear, companies are scouting smaller cities to open shop and expand reach to cater to soaring growth

items.title: More IPO money funnels into capex in 2025 even as India Inc keeps powder dry
items.summary: Capex allocations have jumped while acquisition and affiliate spends have shrunk this year. New entrants are reshaping India Inc’s IPO deployment mix with more tangible assets and low debt on books.

items.title: Mint Explainer: Does India need special courts for complex drug patent wars?
items.summary: Timelines for patent disputes in India can stretch years, often a setback for companies working with time-sensitive patent deadlines.

items.title: Mint Explainer | Why Indian Railways is betting on QSR chains
items.summary: A new IRCTC catering category allows national food brands into stations for the first time. Here’s what’s driving the shift, and what it means for Railways, QSRs and small vendors.

items.title: Mint Explainer | India, Russia to deepen nuclear ties: What it means for India’s 100 GW goal
items.summary: Following President Vladimir Putin’s visit, India and Russia agreed to deepen cooperation at Kudankulam, advance work on a second nuclear site, and step up joint development and localization of nuclear technology.

items.title: Mint Explainer | Dirty air trick: How North Indian rice farmers outsmart satellites
items.summary: With 28,000 square kilometres of crop area lit in 2025 in Punjab and Haryana, the contribution of farm fires to North India’s bad air is likely to be much higher than what is currently estimated, finds a new study.

items.title: Mint Explainer | Can 72,000 public chargers fix India’s slow EV adoption?
items.summary: With only 29,000 public chargers today, India’s push to add 72,000 more raises a bigger question: will the infrastructure keep pace with accelerating EV demand?

items.title: Meet the bot collector: How AI is rewriting India’s debt recovery playbook
items.summary: A revolution is playing out quietly in the world of debt recovery, thanks to artificial intelligence. Bots are now collecting debts, and apparently doing so with a human emotion that too many human collectors lack: empathy. A fascinating inside story.

items.title: Kantara, Chhaava, Saiyaara top movies of 2025; live entertainment soars: BookMyShow  report
items.summary: BookMyShow’s report highlights a surge in cinema attendance in India in 2025. Live entertainment flourished, showcasing 17% growth, with music tourism and premium experiences driving significant economic impact across cities nationwide.

items.title: JioHotstar to invest  ₹4,000 crore in South India-focused content
items.summary: JioHotstar has scheduled 1,500 hours of new programming in all four southern languages for release over the next 12 months.

items.title: IndusInd Bank chairman Sunil Mehta to step down in January: Report
items.summary: IndusInd Bank Chairman Sunil Mehta plans to resign after his term ends amid significant losses and governance issues. The bank is undergoing restructuring, with new leadership appointments aimed at addressing financial issues.

items.title: India must close trade deals, build AI to leverage Goldilocks moment, says Sunil Mittal
items.summary: Bharti Airtel chairman Sunil Mittal urged policymakers to speed up reforms, warning that unfinished negotiations and bottlenecks could slow India’s growth trajectory.

items.title: IndiGo’s December chaos is unfolding—and passengers are paying the price
items.summary: IndiGo’s worst operational crunch in years has triggered mass delays, cancellations and fare spikes, with travellers scrambling for alternatives.

items.title: IndiGo flight mess disrupts travel plans—but hotels find an unexpected lifeline
items.summary: What cushioned the impact was that the IndiGo crisis unfolded over a weekend when business travel is typically minimal.

items.title: IndiGo flight cancellations force DGCA U-turn on pilot rest rule
items.summary: DGCA allows airlines to substitute leave with weekly rest when rostering pilots and flight crew.

items.title: Govt clears two fund managers to roll out  ₹1 trillion deep-tech RDI scheme
items.summary: The first tranche of startup applications under the RDI scheme is expected by March 2026, following approvals for Birac and TDB and the near-finalization of Sidbi and SBI-AIF as fund managers.

items.title: FMCG input costs are moving in opposite directions—what it means for margins
items.summary: A sharp split in raw-material prices, from softening palm oil and packaging costs to rising sugar, coffee and fishmeal, is setting up an uneven margin outlook for India’s biggest FMCG companies for the coming quarters.

items.title: Down to the bone: Young consumers increasingly want clean, portioned and recipe-ready meats
items.summary: Companies like Licious and Zappfresh report that boneless meat commands a premium due to convenience, changing how meat is processed and marketed, despite traditional preferences for bone-in cuts.

items.title: Creative Churn: Indian advertising agencies dread layoffs as AI upends industry globally
items.summary: Two of the Big 5 advertising holding companies–Omnicom and Interpublic Group–have agreed to merge globally. That has triggered a wave of job cuts, and local agencies are also bracing for a shakeup.

items.title: Can nostalgia alone carry popular TV shows to big screen glory?
items.summary: Television and streaming show creators are adapting popular series like Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hain and Mirzapur into films, aiming to leverage established fan bases. Experts warn that while this strategy can attract audiences, it risks diluting brand value if not executed with narrative depth.

items.title: Bank holiday today: Are banks open or closed on Saturday, 6 December? Check details here
items.summary: Bank holiday today: Banks across India are usually open on first, third or fifth Saturdays of the month unless there is an exceptional holiday.

items.title: Bank holiday today: Are banks open or closed on 9 December? Check inside
items.summary: Bank holiday today, 9 December: Bank holidays differ from region to region, depending on festivals or other special occasions like elections. Since there are Kerala local body polls on Tuesday, there is a bank holiday in Kerala.

items.title: Bank Holidays next week: Banks to remain closed for 4 days between 8-14 December — See full list
items.summary: Bank holidays next week: Banks are typically closed on regional holidays, national holidays and the weekends. While only certain parts of India observe bank holidays during the regional holidays, all banks remain closed during national observances.

items.title: Automation turns up the heat on IT firms’ digital marketing units
items.summary: As automation and GenAI accelerate creative output, IT-backed marketing units from TCS to Info Edge and Accenture are facing pressure on hiring, pricing and long-term viability.

items.title: Auto PLI disbursals jump to  ₹1,350 crore so far, about  ₹1,000 cr in FY26
items.summary: The disbursals in FY26 comes after a rare-earth magnet supply shock in April due to China's strict export control. These magnets are used in crucial manufacturing sectors such as defence, electronics, renewable energy and automobiles, including electric vehicles.

items.title: Ad fatigue is making India’s OTT viewing miserable
items.summary: Indian OTT platforms face viewer fatigue due to repetitive and lengthy ad breaks. Experts emphasize the need for improved ad experiences and transparency to regain user trust and prevent subscription cancellations amid growing customer frustration.
